TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract NewFile implements class Microsoft.Office.Core._IMsoDispObj

Docs.summary: The NewFile object represents items listed on the New Item task pane available in several Microsoft Office applications.

remarks.para: The following table shows the property to use to access the NewFile object in each of the applications.
Use the method to add a new item to the New Item task pane. Use the method to remove an item from the New Item task pane.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Add (string FileName, object Section, object DisplayName, object Action);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Add([in]string FileName, [in]object Section, [in]object DisplayName, [in]object Action) runtime managed
Public Function Add (FileName As String, Optional Section As Object, Optional DisplayName As Object, Optional Action As Object) As Boolean

Docs.param: Required String. The name of the file to add to the list of files on the task pane.
Optional Object. The section to which to add the file. Can be any constant.
Optional Object. The text to display in the task pane.
Optional Object. The action to take when a user clicks on the item. Can be any constant.
Docs.summary: Adds a new item to the New Item task pane.

remarks.para: This method returns True if the item was successfully added; False otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Application { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an Application object that represents the container application for the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns 1297307460, which represents the string MSWD; if created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns 1480803660. This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode in Word, or xlCreatorCode in Excel.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

The Creator property always returns the numeric identifier for the active application, just as the property always returns the name of the active application in string form. Use the CreatedBy property of the , , , and objects to return the name of the individual who created those objects. Use document properties to return information about the authors of Office documents.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Remove (string FileName, object Section, object DisplayName, object Action);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Remove([in]string FileName, [in]object Section, [in]object DisplayName, [in]object Action) runtime managed
Public Function Remove (FileName As String, Optional Section As Object, Optional DisplayName As Object, Optional Action As Object) As Boolean

Docs.param: Required String. The name of the file reference.
Optional Object. The section of the task pane where the file reference exists. Can be any constant.
Optional Object. The display text of the file reference.
Optional Object. The action taken when a user clicks on the item. Can be any constant.
Docs.summary: Removes an item from the New Item task pane.
